
For the 'old Faithful' waiting times, the effect of changing the bin width can be see in Fig. \@ref(fig:BimodalFaithfulHistoChangeBins).

```{r, BimodalFaithfulHistoChangeBins, fig.align="center", fig.width=5.5, fig.height=2.5, fig.cap="Changing the bin width can change the impression of the distribution", out.width='100%'}
par( mfrow = c(1, 3))

hist(faithful$waiting,
     main  = "'Old Faithful'\nwaiting times",
     sub = "Sensible number of bins",
     xlab = "Waiting times (in minutes)",
     ylab = "Frequency",
     breaks = 12,
     col = plot.colour)
hist(faithful$waiting,
     main  = "'Old Faithful'\nwaiting times",
     sub = "Too many bins",
     xlab = "Waiting times (in minutes)",
     ylab = "Frequency",
     breaks = 50,
     col = plot.colour)
hist(faithful$waiting,
     main  = "'Old Faithful'\nwaiting times",
     sub = "Too few bins",
     xlab = "Waiting times (in minutes)",
     ylab = "Frequency",
     breaks = 3,
     col = plot.colour)

```
